subject: Learning
title: Learning Disabilities: Different, Not Less
description: A fast breakdown of Learning Disabilities: Different, Not Less for builders.

hook.text: Einstein didn't speak until age 4. Edison was called 'addled' by his teacher. Different brains learn differently.

buildup.text: Learning disabilities like dyslexia, dyscalculia, and ADHD affect how the brain processes specific types of information.

discovery.text: They are neurological differences, not laziness or low intelligence. Many affected individuals have above-average IQ.

twist.text: With proper supportâ€”structured teaching, assistive tech, accommodationsâ€”most children with LDs thrive academically.

climax.text: Early identification and intervention are crucial. The longer a disability goes unseen, the harder it is to address.

punchline.text: A different brain isn't a broken brain. It just needs a different path.

quiz.question: What is the most important factor in supporting children with learning disabilities?
options: Waiting for children to outgrow the disability naturally
